meanings.definition: Used to introduce a statement that contrasts with or seems to contradict a previous statement.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to go out, buts it started raining heavily.
meanings.sent2: I like ice cream, buts I'm lactose intolerant.
meanings.sent3: He said he was a great cook, buts his burnt toast proved otherwise.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was warm, buts her eyes told a different story.
meanings.sent5: The movie was funny, buts the ending was unexpectedly sad.

meanings.sent1: Everyone was invited to the party buts John.
meanings.sent2: I like all fruits buts bananas.
meanings.sent3: The store had all items on sale buts the new arrivals.
meanings.sent4: The park was empty buts a few squirrels playing around.
meanings.sent5: The room was quiet buts the ticking clock.

meanings.sent1: She thought he was angry, buts he was actually laughing.
meanings.sent2: The day seemed dull, buts the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: He looked tired, buts he danced energetically all night.
meanings.sent4: The room appeared small, buts the mirror made it seem larger.
meanings.sent5: The book cover was plain, buts the story inside was captivating.
